hi and welcome you listening to the x-22
report my name is Dave and zip sewed
1517 a and today's date is March 9th
2018 and the title of the episode is
POTUS will ask the people do we need the
Fed let's get into the economic collapse
financial news now as we know since
Trump came into office nothing has
really changed in the economy yes Trump
has been doing many different things
around the world trying to bring
manufacturing back to the states
implemented tariffs reciprocal taxes
draining the deep swamp doing a lot of
things but the underlying economy that
was there before has not changed
remember the central banking system is
still controlling the economy of course
they can't control how many stores stay
open how people spend their money but
they can control pretty much everything
else and they do have the control right
now now after seven straight months of
growth wholesale sales tumbled in
January this is the worst drop since
2016 we're also seeing that the housing
market is having a problem and the
problem is liquidity a liquidity crisis
in the housing is on the way now non
banks are at the center of this storm
now the Brookings Institute says a
liquidity crisis in the mortgage market
is headed our way I mean it's coming
right at us
now non banks they originate about half
of all the mortgages in 2016 and 75% of
mortgages are insured by the FHA or VA
and this is a problem and when we start
to look at what has been going on here
the big banks have basically shifted and
they have allowed the non banks to
originate most of the mortgages now if
we go back prior to 2008 it was actually
the opposite and we know that the Fed
they had to buy up all this toxic real
estate this is what they're trying to
unwind right now and this is very
difficult to do because you got to find
you know investors that are going to
purchase these and we see right now that
if we look closely at these non-bank
companies we see there are problems and
there's going to be huge problems now
there's a lot of stress on Ginnie Mae
operations from their non-bank
counterparties and basically what the
Brookings Institute came out with was it
says today's almost two-thirds of Ginnie
Mae guaranteed securities are issued by
independent mortgage banks and
independent mortgage bankers are using
some of the most sophisticated financial
engineering that this industry has ever
seen or are also seeing greater
dependence on credit lines
securitization involving multiple
players and more frequent trading of
servicing rights and all these things
that have created a new and challenging
environment for Ginnie Mae in other
words the risk is a lot higher and
business models of our issuers are a lot
more complex add in sharply higher
annual volumes and these risks are
amplified many times over also we have
depended on sheer luck luck that the
economy does not fall into a recession
and increase mortgage delinquencies luck
that our independent mortgage bankers
remain able to access their line of
credit and luck that nothing critical
falls through the cracks and once this
does happen where we have a credit
problem where we enter a recession well
guess what we're gonna see that there's
going to be a problem in this area and
again the big banks have been pushing
this on to the non banks and letting
them pick up the slack because they've
seen what has happened the last time and
they don't want this to happen to
themselves
once again when this whole thing hits
now non banks are vulnerable to
macroeconomic shocks rising interest
rates what is the Fed doing right now
they're raising the interest rates home
price declines we're starting to see
home prices starting to decline and job
losses now
this is happening while debt-to-income
ratios are on the rise and median FICO
scores are dropping this is hardly
surprising given homes are not
affordable
Brookings provides the failure hierarchy
and failure is a given to keep the
latest bubble going nom banks kept
lowering and lowering their credit
standards as home prices kept rising and
rising this is a recipe for disaster and
this disaster is right in front of us
we're starting to see credit card
delinquencies well they are priced as if
they will be paid back they won't we
know they won't and as soon as the

will mount in turn this will reduce the
amounts banks will be willing to lend
subprime corporations who had had been

will find they are priced out of the
market
unable to roll over their debt in a fiat

were the real world works and we're
going to see that all of these things
where they try to use these certain

mortgages and place this over here this
is almost like the subprime securities
where they said oh let's create these
securities we'll just take all the

they're triple-a pensions will purchase

everything will be fantastic and we find

and this is Kansas City Fed president
Esther George said listen the unwind is
too slow right now this is why we're
seeing what we're seeing in the market
what we need to do is we need to speed
this up and then start raising the rates
rapidly well this tells me that what
they're doing is not having the effect
that they really want and this is a
trial balloon that they're throwing out
there to see
if everyone says yeah let's do this
because what they really want to do is
they want to unwind their balance sheet
very very quickly raise the interest
rates now she's talking about raising
the interest rates about six times about
25 basis point each time and they want
to bring the federal funds rate back up
over three percent and you know what's
going to happen if they do this if you
go back to prior to 2008 they did the
same thing they started to raise the

they didn't start at around zero percent
they started up a little bit higher but
here we are at zero percent and they
want to bring this or very close to zero
percent and they want to bring this up
and they want to do it very very quickly
and they want to unwind very quickly
which tells me that they're very nervous
and afraid that they're not going to
have the narrative for this whole thing

know that Trump went ahead and got rid

we needed the knowledge

he's going to ask the people if we

what happens if he drops the Fed what

he tried to issue a silver certificate
it was issued by the Treasury put it out

to do with gold and the it's a US

the reason I do believe that this was

listen everyone thanks a lot for
